com.filesActions

Class WriteInExternalFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.filesActions.WriteInExternalFiles

  • public class WriteInExternalFiles
extends java.lang.Object
    WriteInExternalFiles extratcs informations from ArrayLists needed to be saved in external files
    This class contains 3 public functions :
    • @see writePatientFile
    • @see writeExaminationFile
    • @see writeRoomFile

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    C.DEBAISIEUX

    • Field Summary

      file, fileW and bufferW are File related objects put in private static to be used only by all the functions of this class

      WriteInExternalFiles() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void writeExaminationFile(java.util.ArrayList<Examen> arrayExamination)
      This function is used for saving Examens' informations
      Each Examen stored in arrayExamination is extracted thanks to a loop The Examen's informations are saved in Examen.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Examen class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
      Examen.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using
      static void writePatientFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> arrayPatient)
      This function is used for saving Patients' informations
      Each Patient stored in arrayPatient are extracted thanks to a loop The patient's informations are saved in Patient.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Patient class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
      patient.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using
      static void writeRoomFile(java.util.ArrayList<Chambre> arrayRoom)
      This function is used for saving Chambres' informations
      Each Chambre stored in arrayRoom is extracted thanks to a loop The Chambre's informations are saved in Chambre.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Chambre class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
      Chambre.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using

      • WriteInExternalFiles

    • Method Detail

      • writePatientFile

        public static void writePatientFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> arrayPatient)
        This function is used for saving Patients' informations
        Each Patient stored in arrayPatient are extracted thanks to a loop The patient's informations are saved in Patient.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Patient class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
        patient.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using
        Parameters:
        arrayPatient - : used to keep the Patient object extracted from external file or created by the user
        See Also:
        Patient.toString()

      • writeExaminationFile

        public static void writeExaminationFile(java.util.ArrayList<Examen> arrayExamination)
        This function is used for saving Examens' informations
        Each Examen stored in arrayExamination is extracted thanks to a loop The Examen's informations are saved in Examen.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Examen class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
        Examen.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using
        Parameters:
        arrayExamination - : used to keep the Examen object extracted from external file or created by the user
        See Also:
        Examen.toString()

      • writeRoomFile

        public static void writeRoomFile(java.util.ArrayList<Chambre> arrayRoom)
        This function is used for saving Chambres' informations
        Each Chambre stored in arrayRoom is extracted thanks to a loop The Chambre's informations are saved in Chambre.txt that is created at the project's root For saving those informations a toString function is override in Chambre class The finally block is used to certify that the buffer has weel been closed before quitting the function
        Chambre.save is only used in writing and reading Object and allow the application to switch beetween toString options this param doesn't have Getter and Setter functions to reduce all wrong using
        Parameters:
        arrayRoom - : used to keep the Chambre object extracted from external file
        See Also:
        Chambre.toString()
